Notes.Text:
This update for less fixes the following issues:

- CVE-2024-32487: Fixed mishandling of \n character in paths when LESSOPEN is set leads to OS command execution. (bsc#1222849)

Notes.Title: Patchnames

Relationships.RelatesToProductReference: SUSE Linux Enterprise High Performance Computing 15 SP4-ESPOS
SUSE Linux Enterprise High Performance Computing 15 SP4-LTSS
SUSE Linux Enterprise Module for Basesystem 15 SP5
SUSE Linux Enterprise Server for SAP Applications 15 SP4

Vulnerabilities.Description: less through 653 allows OS command execution via a newline character in the name of a file, because quoting is mishandled in filename.c. Exploitation typically requires use with attacker-controlled file names, such as the files extracted from an untrusted archive. Exploitation also requires the LESSOPEN environment variable, but this is set by default in many common cases.

ProductID: SUSE Linux Enterprise High Performance Computing 15 SP4-ESPOS:less-590-150400.3.9.1
